intro: Oxygonum quarrei, commonly known as the yellow-eyed grass, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Xyridaceae. It is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves and bright yellow flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. It is native to parts of North America and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Oxygonum quarrei plays a role in stabilizing soil and supporting local wildlife by providing nectar for pollinators.
